noun.description: A long-bodied chiefly marine fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, a prominent dorsal fin, and toothlike scales. Most sharks are predatory, although the largest kinds feed on plankton, and some can grow to a large size.
A small Southeast Asian freshwater fish with a tail resembling that of a shark, popular in aquaria.
A light grayish-brown European moth, the male of which has pale silvery hind wings.

origin: Late 16th century: perhaps from German Schurke worthless rogue, influenced by shark.
